Temporal Stability Analysis for MONECA Clustering

Source: R/temporal_stability.R
temporal_stability_analysis.Rd

Usage

temporal_stability_analysis(
  temporal_result,
  stability_threshold = 0.7,
  min_segment_size = 2,
  compute_node_metrics = TRUE,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

temporal_result

A moneca_temporal object returned by moneca_temporal.

stability_threshold

Numeric threshold (0-1) for considering a segment stable. Default is 0.7 (70

min_segment_sizeMinimum number of nodes for a segment to be included in stability calculations. Default is 2.

compute_node_metricsLogical indicating whether to compute detailed node-level metrics. Default is TRUE.

verboseLogical indicating whether to show progress messages. Default is TRUE.

An object of class "temporal_stability" containing:

stability_scores

Data frame with per-segment and overall stability metrics

node_trajectories

Matrix showing the path of each node through segments

change_points

Vector of window indices with significant restructuring

stable_core

Character vector of nodes with consistent segment membership

volatile_nodes

Character vector of frequently changing nodes

segment_lifetimes

Data frame with segment appearance and persistence

transition_summary

Summary statistics of the transition matrix

volatility_scores

Per-node volatility scores

parameters

Analysis parameters used

Analyzes the stability and evolution of segments across time periods, providing comprehensive metrics on segment persistence, node volatility, and structural changes in the mobility network. The function computes several types of stability metrics:Segment-level metrics:

  • Persistence: Proportion of windows where segment appears

  • Stability: Average proportion of nodes retained between consecutive windows

  • Size variability: Coefficient of variation in segment size

  • Core size: Number of nodes always in the segment

Node-level metrics:

  • Volatility: Frequency of segment changes

  • Loyalty: Proportion of time in most frequent segment

  • Trajectory complexity: Number of unique segments visited

System-level metrics:

  • Overall stability: Weighted average of segment stabilities

  • Fragmentation index: Rate of segment splits and merges

  • Change points: Windows with above-average restructuring

moneca_temporal for temporal clustering, plot_temporal_stability for visualization
